description.narrative:
Project outcome: stakeholders: Increased Access to Finance for SMEs. IFC's investment will allow Lulalend to grow its portfolio of uncollateralized loans targeted to micro and small enterprises. Lulalend serves customers with annual revenues ranging between ZAR500K and ZAR50MM ($36K - $3.5MM), with an average loan size of ~$10,000. Their primary target customers are those that have less than ZAR10MM ($700K) revenue per year. These firms are below the lending thresholds of traditional banks that typically offer them transactional services and wouldn't be able to access credit from formal sources. 89% percent of Lulalend's customers are estimated to be first time business borrowers.
Contribution to market creation: Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to promoting systemic changes in the MSME lending market in South Africa in line with other investments made under the SME Push Program in the country. Lulalend specializes on MSME lending, maintaining low operating costs compared to banks and other full-service providers. We expect the success of Lulalend to contribute to greater competitiveness and innovation in the market through two channels: i) demonstrating the viability of extending credit to smaller MSMEs, leading new entrants, as well as existing financial service providers to emulate its business model and its products, ii) partnering with at least one larger financial institution in South Africa to serve these segments through partnerships or the development of white-label technology solution for serving micro and small enterprises.

The proposed project is a US$2.8 million equity investment into Lulalend, an online uncollateralized MSME lending platform based in Cape Town, South Africa. Lulalend leverages technology to provide loans to banked but underserved businesses in South Africa. Lulalends customers are MSMEs with annual turnover ranges of $36K-3.5MM, from the retail, services, manufacturing, logistics and construction sectors. IFCs investment will help increase access to finance for micro and small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in South Africa.
